meanings.definition: A woman thought to have magic powers, especially evil ones, popularly depicted as wearing a black cloak and pointed hat and flying on a broomstick.
meanings.sent1: The witches gathered around the cauldron to brew their magical potion.
meanings.sent2: In the story, the witches put a curse on the princess.
meanings.sent3: The witches decided to have a costume party and all dressed up as spooky characters.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the forest like the cackle of witches.
meanings.sent5: The image of the witches on broomsticks was etched in his mind forever.

meanings.definition: A person who practices witchcraft; a sorcerer or sorceress.
meanings.sent1: The old village witch was known for her healing potions.
meanings.sent2: The witches of the coven gathered under the full moon for their ritual.
meanings.sent3: The little girl dressed up as a witch for Halloween and pretended to cast spells on her toys.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious woman in the woods was rumored to be a powerful witch.
meanings.sent5: The witch's crystal ball revealed the future to those who sought her guidance.

meanings.definition: To cast a spell over; bewitch.
meanings.sent1: The enchantress witches the prince, causing him to fall in love with her.
meanings.sent2: The evil sorcerer witches the kingdom, bringing darkness upon the land.
meanings.sent3: The magician accidentally witches himself while practicing a new spell.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious potion seemed to witch anyone who dared to drink it.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the music seemed to witch all who heard it, filling them with a sense of longing.
